title: SI Get Offering Response
description: Offering details, availability status, and optionally matching products. Use the offering_token in si_initiate_session for correlation.

available.description: Whether the offering is currently available

offering_token.description: Token to pass to si_initiate_session for session continuity. Brand stores the full query context server-side (products shown, order, context) so they can resolve references like 'the second one' when the session starts.

ttl_seconds.description: How long this offering information is valid (seconds). Host should re-fetch after TTL expires.

checked_at.description: When this offering information was retrieved

matching_products.description: Products matching the request context. Only included if include_products was true.

availability_summary.description: Brief availability info (e.g., 'In stock', 'Size 14 available', '3 left')

total_matching.description: Total number of products matching the context (may be more than returned in matching_products)

alternative_offering_ids.description: Alternative offerings to consider if this one is unavailable

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
